description: [Status: stable] [Name: invalid-bytes-return-type] [Message: __bytes__ does not return bytes] What it does Checks for __bytes__ implementations that return types other than bytes. Why is this bad? The __bytes__ method should return a bytes object. Returning a different type may cause unexpected behavior. Example class Foo: def __bytes__(self): return 2 Use instead: class Foo: def __bytes__(self): return b"2"
